sub_title: student of SEEP (socio ecological economics and policy) @WU & Recruiting @socialbee
summary: With an academic background in Global Project and Change Management, I am passionate about intersectional justice and minority rights. My own intercultural and intersectional background and personal experiences drive me to work in the field of international social and public affairs. In recent years, I have specialized in research and consultancy projects on disability, rare diseases, and gender. I am well versed in project management, and together with my passion for social justice, I strive to plan and implement effective and sustainable social impact projects. I have been able to gain valuable experience in numerous sustainable projects and look forward to new opportunities to develop my interests and skills.

projects.title: Value Creators Single Stories and Intersectional Discrimination
projects.description: I worked in a team of four students on the wicked problem of intersectional discrimination. Inspired by the TED talk "The danger of a Single Story" by Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie we developed the concept of Second Stories to break Single Stories and turn them into multi-facetted stories. Depending on the nature of it, a Single Story quickly leads to exclusion and discrimination of those affected by it. Our platform, SpreadSecondStories is here to give storytelling power to people who feel that a Single Story wrongly represents them. We enable you to meet the humans that Single Stories usually hide behind stereotypes.

contributors.headline: student of SEEP (socio ecological economics and policy) @WU & Recruiting @socialbee
Student - M.Sc. Strategic Leadership Towards Sustainability

projects.title: Sustainable Democracy Trends and Scenario Analysis
projects.description: I worked in a remote team on Sustainable democracy for the province Overijssel in the Netherlands. We implemented a trend and scenario analysis by conducting qualitative research in the format of interviews to find out trends in democracy and democratic participation. The project deliverable was an advisory report, which we handed over to our client in the province Overijssel.

contributors.headline: student of SEEP (socio ecological economics and policy) @WU & Recruiting @socialbee

projects.title: Qualitative Research Project on Social Model of Disability & Disability Mainstreaming
projects.description: For a month I conducted qualitative research on the inclusion of people with disabilities. Therefore, I started by reading literature and interviewed up to 10 experts, who are working in the field of inclusion in different areas: NGOs, social entrepreneurs, politicians, activists. The topics I focused on are the social construct of disability, universal design and disability mainstreaming. All findings were summarised in a dossier. My biggest personal learning was how to be more active in inclusion as a person with a disability myself.

contributors.headline: student of SEEP (socio ecological economics and policy) @WU & Recruiting @socialbee

projects.title: Municipality Project: Connecting local initiatives working on sustainability in Zwolle
projects.description: The research project was focused on developing a handbook on the role of the municipality to empower new green initiatives and connecting established initiatives working on sustainability in Zwolle. Therefore, interviews, surveys were conducted. Also, best practices were analysed and used to develop the handbook for the municipality.

Student bij Windesheim Honours College | Education Choreographer

projects.title: Sustainability Awareness Project in Windesheim University
projects.description: The project aimed to increase awareness of sustainability on campus. We implemented an interactive event, which included a guest lecture on how to live zero waste as a student and designed sustainability games to achieving awareness around the topic of sustainabilty on campus.

Project Manager | Marketing & Sales | Business Development | B2B | Global Project & Change Management Graduate
International Business student aan de Hanze Hogeschool

projects.title: City Oasis Project in Sonthofen
projects.description: Together with a team of around 15 students, architects and asylum seekers, we established a city oasis project to encourage a multicultural and open-minded community in Sonthofen. We built the city oasis and hosted events for three weeks in total. The school project inspired and motivated me to study project management to create sustainable change.

profile_positions.description:
Implementation of RDI's public affairs strategies through event management, organization of panel discussions, development and implementation of accessibility guidelines, mapping of UN bodies' activities in the field of rare diseases, and participation in policy and advocacy events.

Development of an advocacy strategy for the establishment of a working group with RDI members on the topic of rare diseases and disability, on the basis of research findings.

profile_positions.description: Spread Second Stories is a platform where we invite you to tell the kind of stories that people usually do not listen to. Second Stories are all the other stories that add to the completeness and complexity of the person that a Single Story fails to describe. With this, we set a small step towards a world of equal life opportunities for everyone.

profile_positions.description: In a team of four students, we conducted a qualitative research project with the deliverable of an advisory report for social entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The methods used compared the innovative homecare solutions of the Dutch Buurtzorg model and the Bosnian Centre for Healthy Ageing. This comparison eventually resulted in the development of a model that incorporates innovations and best practices that are relevant to the Bosnian context.

volunteer_experiences.description: I worked in a remote team researching funding organisations and relevant calls for proposals to fund projects of Stay, which support development work. We created a databank, that lists and categories foundations and calls for proposals that are beneficial for projects in Kenya, Ruanda and Uganda.
